channel.title: BATCH help, not java. (Problem solved, Thanks to the -help feature on JDK menu.)
channel.description:
[s]Ok, im trying to make my BATCH file compile all my classes and put them in a specified folder..
Like, instead of it compiling all the classes and putting the class file's everywhere i want them in a folder called "bin", of course.... If anyone can help me with that, Please do. :D[/s] [size=22pt] Solved my own problem, Thanks anyway.[/size]
Never mind, I played around with the -help feature in the JDK menu and i figured it out.
I came up with this conclusion.
[code] @echo off title Compile javac -cp . -d Source/Bin/ ./Source/*.java pause [/code]

item.title: BATCH help, not java. (Problem solved, Thanks to the -help feature on JDK menu.)
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[s]Ok, im trying to make my BATCH file compile all my classes and put them in a specified folder…

Like, instead of it compiling all the classes and putting the class file’s everywhere i want them in a folder called “bin”, of course… If anyone can help me with that, Please do. :D[/s]
[size=22pt]
Solved my own problem, Thanks anyway.[/size]

Never mind, I played around with the -help feature in the JDK menu and i figured it out.

I came up with this conclusion.

@echo off
title  Compile
javac -cp . -d Source/Bin/ ./Source/*.java
pause

Read full topic
item.source: BATCH help, not java. (Problem solved, Thanks to the -help feature on JDK menu.)
